HTMLAttributesRelNoopener.summary: The noopener keyword for the rel attribute of the {{HTMLElement("a")}}, {{HTMLElement("area")}}, and {{HTMLElement("form")}} elements instructs the browser to navigate to the target resource without granting the new browsing context access to the document that opened it â€” by not setting the property on the opened window (it returns null).

remarks.para: This is especially useful when opening untrusted links, in order to ensure they cannot tamper with the originating document via the property (see About rel=noopener for more details), while still providing the Referer HTTP header (unless noreferrer is used as well).
Note that when noopener is used, nonempty target names other than _top, _self, and _parent are all treated like _blank in terms of deciding whether to open a new window/tab.

blockquote.para: Note: Setting target="_blank" on <a> elements now implicitly provides the same rel behavior as setting rel="noopener" which does not set window.opener. See browser compatibility for support status.
